title: Roza - Serving the Yakima River Valley since 1920
snippet: Roza Water Users: For the first time in three years we have confidence that the coming water year should be better than the prior year. How much better remains to be seen and will depend…

title: Jan 2026 Roza water update – Roza Irrigation District
snippet: Jan 12, 2026 · Roza has been formally advocating to enlarge Bumping Reservoir since at least 1968. The five reservoirs reach a combined 678,000 acre feet in storage on 1/8/26, which did not occur in 2025 until May 26. Carry over storage from 2025 to 2026 was functionally zero.

title: 2025 Water Supply – Roza Irrigation District
snippet: The Roza Irrigation District is actively planning for the 2025 irrigation season water supply. Our team is currently working with the Roza Board of Directors on how best to manage the irrigation season.

title: System Information – Roza Irrigation District
snippet: Pumps There are 18 pumping plants containing 57 electric pumps along with 10.8 miles of discharge pipe serving approximately 27,000 acres. The maximum lift is 253 feet. The Roza Power Plant is a reserved works feature owned and operated by the Bureau of Reclamation. The district buys power at the pumping plants.

title: December 2025 Roza update: Reservoir increases, floods and fish
snippet: Dec 17, 2025 · Roza Water Users: Recent rain fall has increased reservoir content by just under 300,000 acre feet in the past 11 days! A significant boost due to the highest 5 day flow period on record.
